parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository without the `.git` extension. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: protected
parameters.description: Setting to `true` returns only branches protected by branch protections or rulesets. When set to `false`, only unprotected branches are returned. Omitting this parameter returns all branches.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100). For more information, see "[Using pagination in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api)."

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of the results to fetch. For more information, see "[Using pagination in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api)."

users.description: The list of users with review dismissal access.

teams.description: The list of teams with review dismissal access.

items.title: Team
items.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

parent.title: Team Simple
parent.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories

privacy.description: The level of privacy this team should have

notification_setting.description: The notification setting the team has set

ldap_dn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) that team maps to within LDAP environment

apps.description: The list of apps with review dismissal access.

items.title: GitHub app
items.description: GitHub apps are a new way to extend GitHub. They can be installed directly on organizations and user accounts and granted access to specific repositories. They come with granular permissions and built-in webhooks. GitHub apps are first class actors within GitHub.

id.description: Unique identifier of the GitHub app

slug.description: The slug name of the GitHub app

name.description: The name of the GitHub app

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the GitHub app

events.description: The list of events for the GitHub app

installations_count.description: The number of installations associated with the GitHub app

bypass_pull_request_allowances.description: Allow specific users, teams, or apps to bypass pull request requirements.

users.description: The list of users allowed to bypass pull request requirements.

teams.description: The list of teams allowed to bypass pull request requirements.

items.title: Team
items.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

parent.title: Team Simple
parent.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories

privacy.description: The level of privacy this team should have

notification_setting.description: The notification setting the team has set

ldap_dn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) that team maps to within LDAP environment

apps.description: The list of apps allowed to bypass pull request requirements.

items.title: GitHub app
items.description: GitHub apps are a new way to extend GitHub. They can be installed directly on organizations and user accounts and granted access to specific repositories. They come with granular permissions and built-in webhooks. GitHub apps are first class actors within GitHub.

id.description: Unique identifier of the GitHub app

slug.description: The slug name of the GitHub app

name.description: The name of the GitHub app

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the GitHub app

events.description: The list of events for the GitHub app

installations_count.description: The number of installations associated with the GitHub app

require_last_push_approval.description: Whether the most recent push must be approved by someone other than the person who pushed it.

lock_branch.description: Whether to set the branch as read-only. If this is true, users will not be able to push to the branch.

allow_fork_syncing.description: Whether users can pull changes from upstream when the branch is locked. Set to `true` to allow fork syncing. Set to `false` to prevent fork syncing.
